current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend title 23, United States Code, to protect States
		  that have in effect laws or orders with respect to pay-to-play reform, and for
		  other purposes.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Environment and Public
			 Works

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
State Ethics Law Protection Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended by adding at the end the following:

text.#text:
A State transportation department shall not be considered
				to have violated a requirement of this section solely because the State in
				which that State transportation department is located, or a local government
				within that State, has in effect a law or an order that limits the amount of
				money an individual or entity that is doing business with a State or local
				agency with respect to a Federal-aid highway project may contribute to a
				political party, campaign, candidate, or elected
				official.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1146 IS: State Ethics Law Protection Act of 2013
